BJ 7.2So I have heard.

CCK 9.2Then the Buddha took up residence for the night in the royal rest-house in Ambalaṭṭhikā together with the Saṅgha of mendicants.

BJ 7.4Then several mendicants rose at the crack of dawn and sat together in the pavilion, where the topic of evaluation came up:

CSP1ED 6.3When the Buddha found out about this discussion on evaluation among the mendicants, he went to the pavilion, where he sat on the seat spread out and addressed the mendicants,

CCK 9.4“Mendicants, if others criticize me, the teaching, or the Saṅgha, don’t make yourselves resentful, bitter, and exasperated.

LV 1.7“If others criticize me, the teaching, or the Saṅgha, you should explain that what is untrue is in fact untrue:

BJ 7.6If others praise me, the teaching, or the Saṅgha, don’t make yourselves thrilled, elated, and excited.
